summary: true/false are not always replaced for !0/!1

comments.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? function some_function() { var fn1; var fn2; if (any_expression) { fn2 = external_ref; fn1 = function (content) { return fn2(); } } return { method1: function () { if (fn1) fn1(); return true; }, method2: function () { return false; } } } What is the expected output? What do you see instead? We expect that true/false will be replaced for !0/!1, but it doesn't happend. function some_function() { var a, b; any_expression && (b = external_ref, a = function () { return b() }); return { method1: function () { a && a(); return true }, method2: function () { return false } } }; What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? This is output for latest official build. I also got the same output for 20120430, 20120305. But 20111117 is OK. Please provide any additional information below. Here is just one of example. I found too many non-replaced true/false in compiler output. Replacement non-replaced true/false to !1/!0 in conpiler output saves 1-2 kb for 850 kb js file.
The peephole optimizations are being short circuited, I'm pretty sure I caused this problem so I'll look into it.
This issue was closed by revision r2119.
